questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Most of everything alive on the planet are single-celled organisms.
questions.explanation: Single-celled organisms, like bacteria, archaea, and protists, constitute the vast majority of life on Earth.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Protists are eukaryotic organisms.
questions.explanation: Protists are a diverse group of eukaryotic microorganisms.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Methanogens derive their energy from methane.
questions.explanation: Methanogens produce methane as a metabolic byproduct; they do not consume it for energy.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Cyanobacteria are the only prokaryotes that use photosynthesis to make their food.
questions.explanation: Cyanobacteria are a phylum of bacteria that obtain their energy through photosynthesis.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Protists likely evolved from bacteria about 1.7 billion years ago.
questions.explanation: The fossil record suggests that eukaryotes, including protists, emerged around 1.7 billion years ago, evolving from prokaryotic ancestors.
